nodes.bodyText: CHANGES_NEXT_RELEASE entry corresponding to the changes in this PR should be added (with a mention of the new configuration parameter being added)

I think is would be a good idea to remark the optionality of this parameter, the following way: This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change | mongo\_replica_set | no | empty | Replica Set name. Usually could be `replica`. | | mongo\_replica_set | no | empty | Replica Set name. Note that this parameter is optional because Cygnus is able to connect to a MongoDB replica set without needing to specify its name. | With regards to replica I think is not so usual :) so better not mention about it.

Usually could be `admin`. | +| mongo\_replica_set | no | empty | Replica Set name. Usually could be `replica`. |

@@ -306,6 +306,7 @@ If `data_model=dm-by-entity` and `attr_persistence=column` then `NGSIMongoSink` | mongo\_username | no | empty | If empty, no authentication is done. | | mongo\_password | no | empty | If empty, no authentication is done. | | mongo\_auth_source | no | empty | Auth source database use to authenticate the user. Usually could be `admin`. | +| mongo\_replica_set | no | empty | Replica Set name. Usually could be `replica`. |

nodes.bodyText:
This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                * CYGNUS_MONGO_REPLICA_SET: Mongo option to specify the replica set name. Usually could be `replica`.
          
          
            
                * CYGNUS_MONGO_REPLICA_SET: Mongo option to specify the replica set name. Note that this env var is optional because Cygnus is able to connect to a MongoDB replica set without needing to specify its name.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -204,6 +204,7 @@ As seen above, the default configuration distributed with the image is tied to c
     * The user for Mongo and STH is `mongo` but can be changed through the CYGNUS_MONGO_USER environment variable.
     * The pass for Mongo and STH is `mongo` but can be changed through the CYGNUS_MONGO_PASS environment variable.
     * CYGNUS_MONGO_AUTH_SOURCE: Mongo option to specify which common user database source to use for authentication. Usually could be `admin`.
+    * CYGNUS_MONGO_REPLICA_SET: Mongo option to specify the replica set name. Usually could be `replica`.

@@ -204,6 +204,7 @@ As seen above, the default configuration distributed with the image is tied to c
     * The user for Mongo and STH is `mongo` but can be changed through the CYGNUS_MONGO_USER environment variable.
     * The pass for Mongo and STH is `mongo` but can be changed through the CYGNUS_MONGO_PASS environment variable.
     * CYGNUS_MONGO_AUTH_SOURCE: Mongo option to specify which common user database source to use for authentication. Usually could be `admin`.
+    * CYGNUS_MONGO_REPLICA_SET: Mongo option to specify the replica set name. Usually could be `replica`.
